Encode a size channel. The first parameter is a list of size encoding options
such as the data to encode, size scaling etc.

    enc =
        encoding
            << size [ mName "population", mMType Quantitative ]
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: smFill
values.comment: Fill color of an interval selection mark (dragged rectangular area).

values.name: smFillOpacity
values.comment: Fill opacity of an interval selection mark in the range 0 to 1.

values.name: smStroke
values.comment: Stroke color of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeDash
values.comment: Stroke dash style of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeDashOffset
values.comment: Stroke dash offset of an interval selection mark.

values.name: smStrokeOpacity
values.comment: Stroke opacity of an interval selection mark in the range 0 to 1.

values.name: smStrokeWidth
values.comment: Stroke width of an interval selection mark.

values.name: soAscending
values.comment: Indicate sorting is to be applied from low to high.

values.name: soByChannel
values.comment:
Sort by another channel.

    position Y
        [ pName "age"
        , pMType Ordinal
        , pSort [ soByChannel chX ]
        ]

values.name: soByField
values.comment:
Sort by the aggregated summary of a given field using a given aggregation
operation. e.g., sort the categorical data field `variety` by the mean age of
the data in each variety category:

    position Y
        [ pName "variety"
        , pMType Ordinal
        , pSort [ soByField "age" opMean, soDescending ]
        ]

values.name: soByRepeat
values.comment:
Sort by the aggregated summaries of the given fields (referenced by a repeat
iterator) using a given aggregation operation.

values.name: soCustom
values.comment: Custom sort order listing data values explicitly.

values.name: soDescending
values.comment: Indicate sorting is to be applied from high to low.

values.name: spacing
values.comment: Spacing between sub-views in a composition operator.

values.name: spacingRC
values.comment:
Similar to [spacing](#spacing) but with independent spacing for rows (first
parameter) and columns (second parameter).

values.name: specification
values.comment:
Define a specification object for use with faceted and repeated small multiples.

    spec = ...
    toVegaLite
        [ facet [ rowBy [ fName "Origin", fMType Nominal ] ]
        , specification spec
        ]

values.name: sphere
values.comment:
Generate a data source that is a sphere for bounding global geographic data.
The sphere will be subject to whatever projection is specified for the view.

    toVegaLite
        [ sphere
        , projection [ prType orthographic ]
        , geoshape [ maFill "aliceblue" ]
        ]

values.name: square
values.comment:
[Square mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/square.html) for symbolising
points.

values.name: stAscending
values.comment: Indicate that the given field should be sorted in ascending order.

values.name: stCenter
values.comment: Offset a stacked layout using a central stack baseline.

values.name: stDescending
values.comment: Indicate that the given field should be sorted in descending order.

values.name: stNone
values.comment: Do not stack marks (produces a layered plot).

values.name: stNormalize
values.comment:
Rescale a stacked layout to use a common height while preserving relative size
of stacked quantities.

values.name: stOffset
values.comment: Stack offset when applying a stack transformation.

values.name: stSort
values.comment: Ordering within a stack when applying a stack transformation.

values.name: stZero
values.comment: Offset a stacked layout using a baseline at the foot of a stack.

values.name: stack
values.comment:
Apply a stack transform for positioning multiple values. This is an alternative
to specifying stacking directly when encoding position. First parameter is the field
to be stacked; the second the fields to group by; the third and fourth are the names
to give the output field names; the fifth lists the optional offset and sort properties.
values.type: String.String -> List.List String.String -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.StackProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: stereographic
values.comment: A stereographic map projection.

values.name: str
values.comment: A string data value.

values.name: stroke
values.comment:
Encode a stroke channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by `color` but
only affects the exterior boundary of marks.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strokeOpacity
values.comment:
Encode a stroke opacity channel. This acts in a similar way to encoding by
`opacity` but only affects the exterior boundary of marks. If both `opacity` and
`strokeOpacity` are specified, `strokeOpacity` takes precedence for stroke encoding.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strokeWidth
values.comment: Encode a stroke width channel.
values.type: List.List VegaLite.MarkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: strs
values.comment:
A list of string data values. Used when declaring inline data with
[dataColumn](#dataColumn), filtering ([fiOneOf](#fiOneOf)), imputation
([imKeyVals](#imKeyVals)) and customized sorting ([soCustom](#soCustom)).

values.name: symArrow
values.comment: Specify a centred arrow symbol for a shape mark. Useful for vector plots.

values.name: symCircle
values.comment: Specify a circular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symCross
values.comment: Specify a cross symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symDiamond
values.comment: Specify a diamond symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symPath
values.comment:
A custom symbol shape as an
[SVG path description](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Tutorial/Paths).

values.name: symSquare
values.comment: Specify a square symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symStroke
values.comment:
Specify a linear symbol for a shape mark. Note that this will only be visible
if the symbol has a stroke setting (unlike all the other areal symbols filling it
has no effect).

values.name: symTriangle
values.comment: Specify a centred triangle symbol for a shape mark. Useful for vector plots.

values.name: symTriangleDown
values.comment: Specify a downward triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symTriangleLeft
values.comment: Specify a leftward facing triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symTriangleRight
values.comment: Specify a rightward facing triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symTriangleUp
values.comment: Specify an upward triangular symbol for a shape mark.

values.name: symWedge
values.comment:
Specify a centred wedge (thin triangle) symbol for a shape mark. Useful for
vector plots.

values.name: tAggregate
values.comment:
Compute some aggregate summary statistics for a field to be encoded with a
text channel. The type of aggregation is determined by the given operation
parameter.

values.name: tBin
values.comment: Discretize numeric values into bins when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tBinned
values.comment: Indicate that data encoded with a text channel are already binned.

values.name: tDataCondition
values.comment:
Make a text channel conditional on one or more predicate expressions. The first
parameter is a list of tuples each pairing an expression to evaluate with the encoding
if that expression is true. The second is the encoding if none of the expressions
are evaluated as true.
values.type: List.List ( VegaLite.BooleanOp, List.List VegaLite.TextChannel ) -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> VegaLite.TextChannel

values.name: tFormat
values.comment:
[Formatting pattern](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/format.html)
for text marks. To distinguish between formatting as numeric values and data/time
values, additionally use [tFormatAsNum](#tFormatAsNum) or [tFormatAsTemporal](#tFormatAsTemporal).

values.name: tFormatAsNum
values.comment:
Indicate that values encoded with a text channel should be formatted as numbers.
To control the precise numeric format, additionally use [tFormat](#tFormat) providing
a [d3 numeric format string](https://github.com/d3/d3-format#locale_format).

values.name: tFormatAsTemporal
values.comment:
Indicate that values encoded with a text channel should be formatted as dates/times.
To control the precise temporal format, additionally use [tFormat](#tFormat) providing
a [d3 date/time format string](https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format).

values.name: tGeo
values.comment:
Indicate a data field encoded as a text property is a geo feature. Equivalent
to `tMType GeoFeature`.

values.name: tMType
values.comment:
Level of measurement when encoding with a text channel. See also [tNominal](#tNominal),
[tOrdinal](#tOrdinal), [tQuant](#tQuant), [tTemporal](#tTemporal) and [tGeo](#tGeo)
for shorthand equivalents.

values.name: tName
values.comment: Name of field used for encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tNominal
values.comment:
Indicate a data field encoded as a text property is nominal. Equivalent to
`tMType Nominal`.

values.name: tOrdinal
values.comment:
Indicate a data field encoded as a text property is ordinal. Equivalent to
`tMType Ordinal`.

values.name: tQuant
values.comment:
Indicate a data field encoded as a text property is quantitative. Equivalent to
`tMType Quantitative`.

values.name: tRepeat
values.comment:
Reference in a text channel to a field name generated by [repeatFlow](#repeatFlow)
or [repeat](#repeat). The parameter identifies whether reference is being made to
fields that are to be arranged in columns, in rows or a with a flow layout.

values.name: tSelectionCondition
values.comment:
Make a text channel conditional on interactive selection. The first parameter
is a selection condition to evaluate; the second the encoding to apply if that
selection is true; the third parameter is the encoding if the selection is false.
values.type: VegaLite.BooleanOp -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> VegaLite.TextChannel

values.name: tTemporal
values.comment:
Indicate a data field encoded as a text property is temporal. Equivalent to
`tMType Temporal`.

values.name: tTimeUnit
values.comment: Time unit aggregation of field values when encoding with a text channel.

values.name: tTitle
values.comment: Title of a field when encoding with a text or tooltip channel.

values.name: text
values.comment:
Encode a text channel. The first parameter is a list of text encoding options
such as the data to encode, number formatting etc.

    enc =
        encoding
            << text [ tName "keyword", tMType Nominal ]
values.type: List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: textMark
values.comment:
[Text mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/text.html) to be
displayed at some point location.

values.name: tfBounds
values.comment: Specify a title anchor position relative to the full bounding box.

values.name: tfGroup
values.comment: Specify a title anchor position relative to the group width / height.

values.name: tiAnchor
values.comment: Anchor position when placing a title.

values.name: tiAngle
values.comment: Angle of title text (degrees from horizontal).

values.name: tiBaseline
values.comment: Vertical alignment of a title.

values.name: tiColor
values.comment: Text colour of a title.

values.name: tiFont
values.comment: Title font.

values.name: tiFontSize
values.comment: Title font size.

values.name: tiFontStyle
values.comment: Title font style (italic etc.).

values.name: tiFontWeight
values.comment: Title font weight.

values.name: tiFrame
values.comment:
Title position anchor. Can be relative to the full bounding box
([frBounds](#frBounds)) or the group in which the titled visualiztion belongs
([frGroup](#frGroup)).

values.name: tiLimit
values.comment: Maximum length of the title display in pixel units.

values.name: tiOffset
values.comment: Offset in pixel units of the title relative to the chart body.

values.name: tiOrient
values.comment: Placement of title relative to the chart body.

values.name: tiStyle
values.comment:
A list of named styles to apply to title. A named style can be specified via
[coNamedStyle](#coNamedStyle) or [coNamedStyles](#coNamedStyles) if more than one
style is required. Later styles in the list will override earlier styles if there
is a conflict in any of the mark properties specified.

values.name: tiZIndex
values.comment:
Drawing order of a title relative to the other chart elements. 1 indicates
title is drawn in front of chart marks, 0 indicates it is drawn behind them.

values.name: tick
values.comment:
Short line ([tick](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/tick.html))
mark for symbolising point locations.

values.name: ticoAnchor
values.comment: Default anchor position when placing titles.

values.name: ticoAngle
values.comment: Default angle when orientating titles (degrees from horizontal).

values.name: ticoBaseline
values.comment: Default vertical alignment when placing titles.

values.name: ticoColor
values.comment: Default color when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFont
values.comment: Default font when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFontSize
values.comment: Default font size when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFontStyle
values.comment: Default font style (italic etc.) when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFontWeight
values.comment: Default font weight when showing titles.

values.name: ticoFrame
values.comment:
Title position anchor. Can be relative to the full bounding box
([frBounds](#frBounds)) or the group in which the titled visualiztion belongs
([frGroup](#frGroup)).

values.name: ticoLimit
values.comment: Default maximum length in pixel units when showing titles.

values.name: ticoOffset
values.comment: Default offset in pixel units of titles relative to the chart body.

values.name: ticoOrient
values.comment: Default placement of titles relative to the chart body.

values.name: ticoStyle
values.comment:
A list of named styles to apply to titles. A named style can be specified via
[coNamedStyle](#coNamedStyle) or [coNamedStyles](#coNamedStyles) if more than one
style is required. Later styles in the list will override earlier
styles if there is a conflict in any of the mark properties specified.

values.name: ticoZIndex
values.comment:
Default drawing order of titles relative to the other chart elements. 1 indicates
titles are drawn in front of chart marks, 0 indicates they are drawn behind them.

values.name: timeUnitAs
values.comment:
Create a new data field based on the given temporal binning. Unlike the
direct encoding binning, this transformation is named and so can be referred
to in multiple encodings. The first parameter is the width of each temporal bin,
the second is the field to bin and the third is name to give the newly binned
field.
values.type: VegaLite.TimeUnit -> String.String -> String.String -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: title
values.comment:
Title to be displayed for a plot. The first parameter is the text of the title,
the second a list of any title properties to configure its appearance.

values.name: toVegaLite
values.comment:
Convert a list of Vega-Lite specifications into a single JSON object that may be
passed to Vega-Lite for graphics generation. Commonly these will include at least
data, mark and encoding specifications.

While simple functions like `bar` may be provided directly, it is usually clearer
to label more complex functions such as encodings with separate expressions.

Specifications can be built up by chaining functions such as [dataColumn](#dataColumn)
or [position](#position). Functional composition using the `<<` operator allows
this to be done compactly:

    let
        data =
            dataFromColumns []
                << dataColumn "a" (strs [ "C", "C", "D", "E" ])
                << dataColumn "b" (nums [ 2, 7, 1, 2 ])

        enc =
            encoding
                << position X [ pName "a", pMType Nominal ]
                << position Y [ pName "b", pMType Quantitative, pAggregate opMean ]
    in
    toVegaLite [ data [], enc [], bar [] ]

values.name: tooltip
values.comment:
Encode a tooltip channel using a single data field.

     tooltip
        [ tName "Month", tMType Temporal, tFormat "%B %Y" ]

To encode multiple tooltip values with a mark, use [tooltips](#tooltips).
values.type: List.List VegaLite.TextChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: tooltips
values.comment:
Encode a tooltip channel using multiple data fields. The first parameter is a
list of the multiple tooltips, each of which is a list of text channel properties
that define the channel.

    tooltips
        [ [ tName "month", tMType Temporal, tFormat "%B %Y" ]
        , [ tName "temperature", tMType Quantitative ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (List.List VegaLite.TextChannel) -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: topojsonFeature
values.comment:
A topoJSON feature format containing an object with the given name. The name
of the object can be found by inspecting the topoJSON file and searching for the
value associated with the `objects` key.

    geodata =
        dataFromUrl "city.json" [ topojsonFeature "boroughs" ]

values.name: topojsonMesh
values.comment:
A topoJSON mesh format containing an object with the given name. Unlike
`topojsonFeature`, the corresponding geo data are returned as a single unified mesh,
not as individual GeoJSON features.

values.name: trail
values.comment:
[Trail mark](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/trail.html) (line
with variable width along its length).

values.name: transform
values.comment:
Create a single transform from a list of transformation specifications. The
order of transformations can be important, e.g. labels created with [calculateAs](#calculateAs),
[timeUnitAs](#timeUnitAs) and [binAs](#binAs) that are used in other transformations.
Using the functional composition pipeline idiom (as example below) allows you to
provide the transformations in the order intended in a clear manner.

    trans =
        transform
            << filter (fiExpr "datum.year == 2010")
            << calculateAs "datum.sex == 2 ? 'Female' : 'Male'" "gender"

values.name: transverseMercator
values.comment: A transverse Mercator map projection.

values.name: true
values.comment:
A true value used for functions that can accept a Boolean literal or a reference
to something that generates a Boolean value. Convenience function equivalent to `boo True`

values.name: tsv
values.comment:
TSV data file format (only necessary if the file extension does not indicate the
type).

values.name: ttData
values.comment:
Indicate tooltips are generated by all fields in the underlying data.

    circle [ maTooltip ttData ]

values.name: ttEncoding
values.comment:
Indicate tooltips should be enebled using the encoded data of the mark.

    circle [ maTooltip ttEncoding ]

values.name: ttNone
values.comment:
Indicate that tooltips should be disabled for the mark (default).

    circle [ maTooltip ttNone ]

values.name: url
values.comment:
Encode a url channel. The first parameter is a list of url channel
properties that characterise the hyperlink to encode with. This is used for
specifying data-driven image files for the [image](#image) mark.

    encData =
        encoding
            << url [ hName "url", hNominal ]

    encLiteral =
        encoding
            << url [ hStr "http://www.imdb.com" ]
values.type: List.List VegaLite.HyperlinkChannel -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: utc
values.comment:
UTC version of a given a time (coordinated universal time, independent of local
time zones or daylight saving). To encode a time as UTC (coordinated universal time,
independent of local time zones or daylight saving), just use this function to convert
another `TimeUnit` generating function.

    encoding
        << position X
            [ pName "date"
            , pMType Temporal
            , pTimeUnit (utc yearMonthDateHours)
            ]

values.name: vConcat
values.comment: Juxtapose some specifications vertically in a row layout of views.

values.name: vaBottom
values.comment: Bottom vertical text alignment.

values.name: vaMiddle
values.comment: Middle vertical text alignment.

values.name: vaTop
values.comment: Top vertical text alignment.

values.name: vicoClip
values.comment: Whether or not by default single views should be clipped.

values.name: vicoCornerRadius
values.comment: The radius in pixels of rounded rectangle corners.

values.name: vicoFill
values.comment: Default fill color for single views.

values.name: vicoFillOpacity
values.comment: Default fill opacity for single views.

values.name: vicoHeight
values.comment: Default height of single views (e.g. each view in a trellis plot).

values.name: vicoOpacity
values.comment: Default overall opacity for single views.

values.name: vicoStep
values.comment: Default step size for x/y discrete fields.

values.name: vicoStroke
values.comment:
Default stroke color for single views. If `Nothing` is provided,
no strokes are drawn around the view.

values.name: vicoStrokeCap
values.comment: Default stroke cap line-ending style for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeDash
values.comment: Default stroke dash style for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeDashOffset
values.comment: Default stroke dash offset for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeJoin
values.comment: Default stroke line-joining style for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeMiterLimit
values.comment: Default stroke mitre limit at which to bevel a line join in single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeOpacity
values.comment: Default stroke opacity for single views.

values.name: vicoStrokeWidth
values.comment: Default stroke width of single views.

values.name: vicoWidth
values.comment: Default width of single views (e.g. each view in a trellis plot).

values.name: viewBackground
values.comment: The background style of a single view or layer in a view composition.

values.name: viewCornerRadius
values.comment: The radius in pixels of rounded corners in single view or layer background.

values.name: viewFill
values.comment: Fill color for a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewFillOpacity
values.comment: Fill opacity for a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewOpacity
values.comment: Overall opacity for a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStroke
values.comment:
Stroke color for line around a single view or layer background. If `Nothing`
is provided, no strokes are drawn around the view.

values.name: viewStrokeCap
values.comment: Stroke cap line-ending around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeDash
values.comment: Stroke dash style for a line around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeDashOffset
values.comment: Stroke dash offset for line around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeJoin
values.comment: Stroke line-joining style around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeMiterLimit
values.comment:
Stroke mitre limit at which to bevel a line join around a single view or
layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeOpacity
values.comment: Stroke opacity around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStrokeWidth
values.comment: Stroke around a single view or layer background.

values.name: viewStyle
values.comment:
A list of named styles to apply to a single view background. A named style
can be specified via [coNamedStyle](#coNamedStyle) or [coNamedStyles](#coNamedStyles)
if more than one style is required. Later styles in the list will override earlier
styles if there is a conflict in any of the mark properties specified.

values.name: wiAggregateOp
values.comment:
An aggregate operation to be used in a window transformation.

    transform
        << window [ ( [ wiAggregateOp opSum, wiField "Time" ], "TotalTime" ) ]
            [ wiFrame Nothing Nothing ]

values.name: wiAscending
values.comment:
Indicate that the given field should be sorted in ascending order when performing
a window transform.

values.name: wiDescending
values.comment:
Indicate that the given field should be sorted in descending order when performing
a window transform.

values.name: wiField
values.comment:
Field for which to compute a window operation. Not needed for
operations that do not apply to fields such as [opCount](#opCount), [woRank](#woRank)
and [woDenseRank](#woDenseRank).

values.name: wiFrame
values.comment:
Moving window for use by a window transform. The two parameters should either
be [Just](https://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm/core/latest/Maybe#Maybe) a number
indicating the offset from the current data object, or
[Nothing](https://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm/core/latest/Maybe#Maybe) to
indicate unbounded rows preceding or following the current data object.

values.name: wiGroupBy
values.comment:
Fields for partitioning data objects in a window transform into separate windows.
If unspecified, all points will be in a single group.

values.name: wiIgnorePeers
values.comment:
Whether or not the sliding window frame in a window transform should ignore
peer values (those considered identical by the sort criteria).

values.name: wiOp
values.comment: Window-specific operation to be used in a window transformation.

values.name: wiParam
values.comment:
Numeric parameter for window-only operations that can be parameterised
(`woPercentile`, `woLag`, `woLead` and `woNthValue`).

values.name: wiSort
values.comment: Comparator for sorting data objects within a window transform.

values.name: width
values.comment:
Override the default width of the visualization in pixel units. If not
specified, the width will be calculated based on the content of the visualization.

    toVegaLite [ width 540, data [], enc [], bar [] ]

How the content is sized relative to this width specification can be customised
with [autosize])(#autosize).

values.name: widthStep
values.comment:
Set the width of the discrete x-field (e.g. individual bars in a bar chart).
The total width is then calculated based on the number of discrete fields (e.g. bars).

    toVegaLite [ widthStep 17, data [], enc [], bar [] ]

values.name: window
values.comment:
Window transform for performing calculations over sorted groups of
data objects such as ranking, lead/lag analysis, running sums and averages.

The first parameter is a list of tuples each comprising a window transform field
definition and an output name. The second is the window transform definition.

       trans =
           transform
               << window [ ( [ wiAggregateOp opSum, wiField "Time" ], "TotalTime" ) ]
                   [ wiFrame Nothing Nothing ]
values.type: List.List ( List.List VegaLite.Window, String.String ) -> List.List VegaLite.WindowProperty -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec -> List.List VegaLite.LabelledSpec

values.name: woCumeDist
values.comment: Cumulative distribution function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woDenseRank
values.comment: Dense rank function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woFirstValue
values.comment: First value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLag
values.comment: Value preceding the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLastValue
values.comment: Last value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woLead
values.comment: Value following the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woNthValue
values.comment: Nth value in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woPercentRank
values.comment: Percentile of values in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woPercentile
values.comment: Value preceding the current object in a sliding window to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woRank
values.comment: Rank function to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: woRowNumber
values.comment: Assign consecutive row number to values in a data object to be applied in a window transform.

values.name: year
values.comment: Year time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearMonth
values.comment: Year and month time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearMonthDate
values.comment: Year, month and day of month time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearMonthDateHours
values.comment: Year, month, day of month and hour of day time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearMonthDateHoursMinutes
values.comment: Time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearMonthDateHoursMinutesSeconds
values.comment: Time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearQuarter
values.comment: Year and year quarter time unit used for discretizing temporal data.

values.name: yearQuarterMonth
values.comment: Year, quarter and month time unit used for discretizing temporal data.
